synopsis: Set in the American South during the 1930s, this novel follows young Scout Finch as her father, lawyer Atticus Finch, defends a Black man falsely accused of rape.
In a totalitarian future society, Winston Smith works for the government rewriting history but secretly dreams of rebellion.
A portrait of the Jazz Age through the story of the fabulously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his love for the beautiful Daisy Buchanan.
The spirited Elizabeth Bennet deals with issues of manners, morality, and marriage in the society of the landed gentry.
Bilbo Baggins, a respectable hobbit, is swept into an epic quest to reclaim a dwarf kingdom from the dragon Smaug.
Teenage Holden Caulfield, expelled from prep school, wanders New York City struggling with his alienation from the adult world.
On the desert planet Arrakis, young Paul Atreides becomes embroiled in a struggle over the galaxy's most valuable resource: the spice melange.
Victor Frankenstein creates a sentient creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment, with tragic consequences.
A father and his young son journey across a bleak, ash-covered America in a post-apocalyptic world.
Theo Decker survives an accident that kills his mother and becomes obsessed with a small painting that reminds him of her.
A criminal psychotherapist becomes obsessed with uncovering the truth behind a woman's act of violence against her husband.
The complex relationship between Marianne and Connell follows them from secondary school through their university years in Dublin.
Between life and death there is a library where each book provides a chance to try another life you could have lived.
The voyage of the whaling ship Pequod, commanded by Captain Ahab, who seeks vengeance on the white whale Moby Dick.
Rodion Raskolnikov, an impoverished ex-student, plans and executes a murder to test his theory about extraordinary men being above the law.
The multi-generational story of the Buendía family and the founding and eventual doom of their town Macondo.
A futuristic World State where happiness is maintained through genetic engineering, drugs, and strict social control.
Esther Greenwood's descent into mental illness and her struggle with societal expectations in 1950s America.
In the Republic of Gilead, Offred navigates life as a Handmaid whose sole purpose is to bear children for the ruling class.
